snippet: Despite a pledge made by world leaders to have women make up at least 30 percent of their national legislatures, most of the world’s parliaments remain largely male.
abstract: Analysis from Inter-Parliamentary Union finds only 44 of 190 countries have legislatures made up of at least 30 percent women, despite 20-year-old promise by world leaders that 30 percent threshold would be achieved; women at Fourth Wold Conference of Speakers of Parliament at United Nations urge male colleagues to push for more representation for women in their legislative bodies.
lead_paragraph: Despite a pledge made by world leaders to have women make up at least 30 percent of their national legislatures, most of the world’s parliaments remain largely male.

headline.main: Most Nations Miss a Goal for Women in Leadership
headline.print_headline: Most Nations Miss a Goal for Women in Leadership
